intro: Palicourea lancifera, commonly known as the Brazilian moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain seeds, and the plant is often found in humid tropical forests. Palicourea lancifera is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
